title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 22 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on 2 Chronicles chapter 22 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 22 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of 2 Chronicles Chapter 22.

questions.question: Who was made king in place of Jehoram according to 2 Chronicles 22:1?
questions.explanation: The inhabitants of Jerusalem made Ahaziah, the youngest son of Jehoram, king in his stead as stated in 2 Chronicles 22:1.

questions.question: How old was Ahaziah when he began to reign as king of Judah?
questions.explanation: Ahaziah was forty-two years old when he began to reign, according to 2 Chronicles 22:2.

questions.question: Who was Ahaziah's mother as mentioned in 2 Chronicles 22:2?
questions.explanation: Ahaziah's mother was Athaliah, daughter of Omri, as stated in 2 Chronicles 22:2.

questions.question: According to 2 Chronicles 22:3, whose ways did Ahaziah walk in?
questions.explanation: Ahaziah walked in the ways of the house of Ahab because his mother was his counselor to do wickedly, as per 2 Chronicles 22:3.

questions.question: What was the reason given for Ahaziah doing evil in the sight of the LORD in 2 Chronicles 22:4?
options: His counselors after his father's death led him to destruction
He followed the laws of Moses
He was guided by the priests
questions.correctAnswer: His counselors after his father's death led him to destruction
questions.explanation: Ahaziah did evil because the house of Ahab, his counselors after his father's death, led him to destruction as described in 2 Chronicles 22:4.

questions.question: With whom did Ahaziah go to war against Hazael, king of Syria?
questions.explanation: Ahaziah went with Jehoram, son of Ahab king of Israel, to war against Hazael at Ramothgilead as per 2 Chronicles 22:5.

questions.question: Where did Jehoram return to be healed after being wounded in battle?
questions.explanation: Jehoram returned to Jezreel to be healed because of wounds given him at Ramah, according to 2 Chronicles 22:6.

questions.question: Why was Ahaziah's destruction said to be from God in 2 Chronicles 22:7?
options: Because he came to Joram and went against Jehu whom God had anointed
Because he built an altar to false gods
questions.correctAnswer: Because he came to Joram and went against Jehu whom God had anointed
questions.explanation: Ahaziah's destruction was from God because he came to Joram and went out against Jehu, whom the LORD had anointed to cut off the house of Ahab (2 Chronicles 22:7).

questions.question: Who killed the princes of Judah and the sons of Ahaziah's brothers that ministered to him?
questions.explanation: Jehu slew the princes of Judah and the sons of Ahaziah's brothers who ministered to him, according to 2 Chronicles 22:8.

questions.question: Where was Ahaziah found and captured before being brought to Jehu?
questions.explanation: Ahaziah was found hiding in Samaria and was caught and brought to Jehu as stated in 2 Chronicles 22:9.

questions.question: True or False: Athaliah destroyed all the royal seed of the house of Judah after Ahaziah's death.
questions.explanation: Athaliah, the mother of Ahaziah, destroyed all the royal seed of the house of Judah when she saw that her son was dead, as mentioned in 2 Chronicles 22:10.

questions.question: Who hid Joash, the son of Ahaziah, from Athaliah?
questions.explanation: Jehosheba, the daughter of the king and wife of Jehoiada the priest, hid Joash from Athaliah as described in 2 Chronicles 22:11.

questions.question: For how many years was Joash hidden in the house of God?
questions.explanation: Joash was hidden in the house of God for six years, according to 2 Chronicles 22:12.

questions.question: True or False: Ahaziah reigned for more than five years in Jerusalem.
questions.explanation: Ahaziah reigned only one year in Jerusalem as stated in 2 Chronicles 22:2.

questions.question: Complete the verse from 2 Chronicles 22:11: 'Jehosheba, the daughter of the king, took Joash the son of Ahaziah, and _____ him from among the king's sons that were slain.'
questions.explanation: The verse says Jehosheba 'stole him from among the king's sons that were slain' (2 Chronicles 22:11).

medium.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 22 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from 2 Chronicles Chapter 22 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling to stay faithful under bad counsel. Based on 2 Chronicles 22, what biblical truth would you share about the influence of advisors?
options: Bad counsel can lead to walking in evil ways and destruction
Counsel has no real impact on one's spiritual walk
Only personal decisions matter, not advice from others
God allows all counsel to succeed regardless of morality
questions.correctAnswer: Bad counsel can lead to walking in evil ways and destruction
questions.explanation: Ahaziah walked in the ways of the house of Ahab because his mother was his counsellor to do wickedly (2 Chronicles 22:3-4). This shows the significant influence advisers have on our spiritual direction.

questions.question: How does 2 Chronicles 22 demonstrate the importance of godly leadership in family and nation?
options: Ungodly leadership leads to downfall and destruction
Leadership has no effect on a family or nation
Only military strength determines a nation's success
Family and nation prosper regardless of leadership
questions.correctAnswer: Ungodly leadership leads to downfall and destruction
questions.explanation: Ahaziah's reign was marked by evil because of his mother's influence and the counsel of the house of Ahab, leading to his destruction (2 Chronicles 22:4,7). This highlights the consequences of ungodly leadership.

questions.question: If a believer is tempted to follow the ways of the world, what guidance does 2 Chronicles 22 offer about obedience to God’s Word?
options: Following the counsel of the ungodly leads to evil in the sight of the LORD
Temptation is inevitable and must be accepted without resistance
Obedience to God is optional in difficult situations
God rewards those who conform to worldly standards
questions.correctAnswer: Following the counsel of the ungodly leads to evil in the sight of the LORD
questions.explanation: Ahaziah did evil in the sight of the LORD because he followed the counsel of the house of Ahab after his father’s death (2 Chronicles 22:4-5). This teaches the importance of obeying God rather than the world.

questions.question: What can we learn from the way Jehoshabeath protected Joash about stewardship and care within the church family?
options: Protecting and nurturing the godly seed is vital to preserving the faith
It is better to ignore dangers and hope they pass
Church members should prioritize their own safety over others
Stewardship only applies to money, not people
questions.correctAnswer: Protecting and nurturing the godly seed is vital to preserving the faith
questions.explanation: Jehoshabeath hid Joash, the rightful heir, from Athaliah’s destruction, demonstrating godly stewardship and care for the future of God's people (2 Chronicles 22:11-12).

questions.question: A believer is discouraged by setbacks and trials. Based on Ahaziah’s story, what biblical truth about perseverance would you share?
options: Trusting God is essential even when facing destruction and enemy attacks
Giving up is the only option when trials come
Human strength alone will overcome all difficulties
God allows trials only to punish without purpose
questions.correctAnswer: Trusting God is essential even when facing destruction and enemy attacks
questions.explanation: Ahaziah was wounded in battle and sought healing, but ultimately faced destruction because he did not walk in God’s ways (2 Chronicles 22:5-9). This encourages believers to trust God through trials.

questions.question: How does 2 Chronicles 22 illustrate the consequences of turning away from God’s ways in leadership?
options: Leaders who do evil bring ruin to themselves and their people
Leaders can do as they please without consequence
God does not judge kings for their actions
Leadership is unrelated to spiritual obedience
questions.correctAnswer: Leaders who do evil bring ruin to themselves and their people
questions.explanation: Ahaziah’s evil led to his death and the destruction of his house’s power (2 Chronicles 22:4,9-10), showing the grave consequences of disobedient leadership.

questions.question: A believer is tempted to rely on political or military alliances instead of God. What does 2 Chronicles 22 teach about seeking God over worldly alliances?
options: Relying on God is vital as worldly alliances may lead to defeat and destruction
Military strength guarantees victory regardless of faith
Alliances with ungodly kingdoms always protect God’s people
God is indifferent to how leaders secure their power
questions.correctAnswer: Relying on God is vital as worldly alliances may lead to defeat and destruction
questions.explanation: Ahaziah allied with Jehoram of Israel to fight Syria but was wounded and eventually killed, showing that reliance on worldly alliances without God’s favor leads to defeat (2 Chronicles 22:5-7).

questions.question: What spiritual principle about prayer and intercession can be learned from Jehoshabeath’s actions in 2 Chronicles 22?
options: Godly intervention in protecting His people is crucial and requires courage
Prayer and intercession are unnecessary in times of danger
Church members should not interfere in political matters
Protection comes only through human power, not divine help
questions.correctAnswer: Godly intervention in protecting His people is crucial and requires courage
questions.explanation: Jehoshabeath risked her life to hide Joash and preserve the royal line, showing the importance of godly courage and intercession (2 Chronicles 22:11-12).

questions.question: True or False: Ahaziah reigned for many years and was remembered as a faithful king who sought the Lord.
questions.explanation: Ahaziah reigned only one year and did evil in the sight of the LORD, influenced by wicked counsel (2 Chronicles 22:2-4).

questions.question: True or False: The destruction of Ahaziah was part of God's judgment because he associated with those who opposed God's purposes.
questions.explanation: The text states that Ahaziah’s destruction was from God because he came to Joram and associated with Jehu, whom God had anointed to cut off Ahab’s house (2 Chronicles 22:7-9).

questions.question: A believer is learning about humility in leadership. Based on Ahaziah’s reign, what biblical virtue about humility can be drawn?
options: Leaders must submit to God’s will and avoid prideful alliances
Pride and reliance on self bring success
Leaders should trust only their own wisdom
questions.correctAnswer: Leaders must submit to God’s will and avoid prideful alliances
questions.explanation: Ahaziah’s failure to walk humbly before God and reliance on ungodly counsel led to his downfall (2 Chronicles 22:3-5).

questions.question: How does the story of Athaliah’s actions in 2 Chronicles 22 warn believers about the consequences of bitterness and revenge?
options: Acting in bitterness leads to destruction and loss of godly legacy
Revenge is justified and brings peace
questions.correctAnswer: Acting in bitterness leads to destruction and loss of godly legacy
questions.explanation: Athaliah destroyed all the royal seed after Ahaziah’s death, showing how bitterness and revenge bring ruin rather than godly restoration (2 Chronicles 22:10).

questions.question: In dealing with temptation to evil counsel, what practical advice does 2 Chronicles 22 provide for believers?
options: Avoid ungodly influences and seek godly counsel instead
Follow popular opinions regardless of their morality
Counsel does not affect one's spiritual health
questions.correctAnswer: Avoid ungodly influences and seek godly counsel instead
questions.explanation: Ahaziah’s downfall was due to following his mother’s wicked counsel and the influence of Ahab’s house (2 Chronicles 22:3-4). This teaches the importance of godly counsel.

questions.question: A believer is encouraged about God’s protection during trials. What does the hiding of Joash teach about God’s providence?
options: God preserves His chosen ones even in dangerous times
God abandons His people in crises
Protection depends solely on human effort
questions.correctAnswer: God preserves His chosen ones even in dangerous times
questions.explanation: Joash was hidden in the house of God for six years, preserving the royal line despite Athaliah’s attempts to destroy it (2 Chronicles 22:11-12).

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Ahaziah was _____ years old when he began to reign, and he reigned _____ year in Jerusalem.
questions.explanation: The scripture explicitly states Ahaziah was forty-two years old when he began to reign and reigned for one year (2 Chronicles 22:2).

hard.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 22 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from 2 Chronicles Chapter 22.

questions.question: Who was made king of Judah after the eldest sons were slain by the Arabians?
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 22:1 states that the inhabitants of Jerusalem made Ahaziah king because the Arabians had slain all the eldest sons.

questions.question: At what age did Ahaziah begin to reign as king of Judah?
questions.explanation: Verse 2 explicitly states Ahaziah was forty-two years old when he began his reign.

questions.question: Who was Ahaziah’s mother, known for influencing him towards evil?
questions.explanation: Verse 3 identifies Athaliah, daughter of Omri, as Ahaziah’s mother and counsellor to do wickedly.

questions.question: How did Ahaziah's behavior reflect the legacy of Ahab's house?
options: He did evil in the sight of the LORD like the house of Ahab
He followed the law strictly unlike Ahab
questions.correctAnswer: He did evil in the sight of the LORD like the house of Ahab
questions.explanation: Verse 4 clearly states Ahaziah did evil like the house of Ahab due to their counsel.

questions.question: What event involved Ahaziah and Jehoram king of Israel fighting Hazael king of Syria?
questions.explanation: Verse 5 describes Ahaziah going with Jehoram to war against Hazael at Ramoth-gilead.

questions.question: Why did Jehoram king of Israel go to Jezreel where Ahaziah also visited?
options: Jehoram was wounded and came to be healed
questions.correctAnswer: Jehoram was wounded and came to be healed
questions.explanation: Verse 6 explains Jehoram returned to Jezreel to be healed because of wounds from battle.

questions.question: Who was anointed by the LORD to cut off the house of Ahab?
questions.explanation: Verse 7 identifies Jehu as the LORD’s anointed to execute judgment on Ahab’s house.

questions.question: What did Jehu do when he found the princes of Judah and Ahaziah’s relatives ministering to him?
questions.explanation: Verse 8 states that Jehu killed the princes and sons of Ahaziah’s brothers.

questions.question: Where was Ahaziah hiding when Jehu sought him?
questions.explanation: Verse 9 says Ahaziah was caught hiding in Samaria and brought to Jehu.

questions.question: True or False: Athaliah spared the royal seed of Judah after Ahaziah's death.
questions.explanation: Verse 10 describes Athaliah destroying all the royal seed after Ahaziah died.

questions.question: Who rescued and hid Joash, son of Ahaziah, from Athaliah?
questions.explanation: Verse 11 identifies Jehosheba, daughter of the king, who stole Joash and hid him.

questions.question: How long was Joash hidden in the house of God?
questions.explanation: Verse 12 states Joash was hidden in the house of God for six years while Athaliah reigned.

questions.question: The name Athaliah connects to which significant Northern Kingdom dynasty through her father Omri?
questions.explanation: Athaliah was daughter of Omri, founder of Ahab's dynasty, which influenced Ahaziah's evil ways (2 Chronicles 22:2-3).

questions.question: Which literary theme is illustrated by the destruction of Ahaziah’s house and the hiding of Joash?
questions.explanation: The chapter shows divine judgment on Ahaziah’s house (verses 7-10) and God's preservation of Joash as a future hope (verses 11-12).

questions.question: Ahaziah's alliance with Jehoram and the war against Hazael foreshadows what recurring biblical motif?
options: Alliance with ungodly rulers leading to downfall
questions.correctAnswer: Alliance with ungodly rulers leading to downfall
questions.explanation: Ahaziah follows Jehoram (house of Ahab) to war (verse 5), illustrating how alliances with ungodly rulers lead to destruction, a motif in Judges and Kings.

theological.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 22 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from 2 Chronicles Chapter 22 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What was the primary reason Ahaziah became king of Judah according to 2 Chronicles 22?
options: The inhabitants of Jerusalem made him king after the eldest sons were slain
He was appointed by the prophets
He seized the throne by force
He was elected by the priests
questions.correctAnswer: The inhabitants of Jerusalem made him king after the eldest sons were slain
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 22:1 states that Ahaziah was made king because the band of men that came with the Arabians killed all the eldest sons, so the people made Ahaziah king. This shows God's providence in preserving the Davidic line despite attacks (cf. 1 Kings 22:51; Psalm 89:3-4; Isaiah 9:6-7; Luke 1:32).

questions.question: At what age did Ahaziah begin to reign, and how long did he reign according to 2 Chronicles 22?
options: 42 years old and reigned one year
30 years old and reigned ten years
25 years old and reigned five years
50 years old and reigned two years
questions.correctAnswer: 42 years old and reigned one year
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 22:2 states Ahaziah was 42 years old when he began to reign and reigned one year. This short reign reflects God's judgment on his wickedness (cf. 1 Kings 22:51; Ezekiel 21:25-27; Daniel 2:21; Acts 13:22).

questions.question: Who influenced Ahaziah to do evil according to the biblical text?
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 22:3 identifies Athaliah, his mother, as his counselor to do wickedly. This highlights the impact of ungodly influences in leadership (cf. 2 Kings 8:18; Proverbs 1:10-16; Matthew 15:14; Romans 1:28-32).

questions.question: In what way did Ahaziah's reign resemble the house of Ahab?
options: He did evil in the sight of the LORD just like them
He built altars to the true God
questions.correctAnswer: He did evil in the sight of the LORD just like them
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 22:4 says Ahaziah did evil like the house of Ahab because of their counsel. This shows the persistence of sin and rebellion against God in the Davidic line at this time (cf. 1 Kings 16:30-33; Romans 3:10-18; Galatians 5:19-21; Hebrews 3:12).

questions.question: With whom did Ahaziah go to war, and what was the outcome?
options: With Jehoram son of Ahab against Hazael king of Syria; Joram was wounded
With the Egyptians against Babylon; victory was won
With the Philistines against Moab; peace was established
With the Assyrians against Edom; defeat was suffered
questions.correctAnswer: With Jehoram son of Ahab against Hazael king of Syria; Joram was wounded
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 22:5 records Ahaziah went with Jehoram to war against Hazael. The Syrians wounded Joram, showing God's sovereignty over nations and judgment on Israel's unfaithfulness (cf. 2 Kings 8:29; Isaiah 10:5-7; Jeremiah 27:5; Romans 13:1).

questions.question: Why did Ahaziah go to Jezreel according to the chapter?
options: To be healed of wounds received at Ramah
To seek an alliance with Israel
questions.correctAnswer: To be healed of wounds received at Ramah
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 22:6 states Ahaziah returned to Jezreel to be healed of wounds from his battle with Hazael. This highlights human frailty and the need for healing (cf. Isaiah 53:4-5; Psalm 147:3; Matthew 8:16-17; James 5:14).

questions.question: What was God's role in the destruction of Ahaziah as described in this chapter?
options: God ordained Jehu to cut off the house of Ahab, which led to Ahaziah's death
God protected Ahaziah from his enemies
God remained neutral in the conflict
questions.correctAnswer: God ordained Jehu to cut off the house of Ahab, which led to Ahaziah's death
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 22:7 explains that God appointed Jehu to execute judgment on Ahab's house, causing Ahaziah's destruction. This demonstrates divine justice and sovereignty (cf. 2 Kings 9:6-10; Romans 12:19; Hebrews 10:30; Revelation 19:11-16).

questions.question: Who executed judgment upon the house of Ahab and the princes of Judah aligned with Ahaziah?
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 22:8 states Jehu executed judgment on the house of Ahab and killed princes of Judah allied with Ahaziah. This shows God's use of human agents to fulfill judgment (cf. 2 Kings 9:1-13; Isaiah 10:5; Romans 13:4; Acts 5:38-39).

questions.question: What was the reason given for burying Ahaziah despite his wickedness?
options: Because he was the son of Jehoshaphat who sought the LORD with all his heart
Because he was a mighty warrior
Because he was the rightful king
questions.correctAnswer: Because he was the son of Jehoshaphat who sought the LORD with all his heart
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 22:9 says Ahaziah was buried because he was Jehoshaphat’s son, who sought the LORD wholeheartedly. This reflects God's covenant faithfulness despite human failure (cf. 1 Kings 22:41-43; Deuteronomy 7:9; Psalm 103:17-18; Hebrews 6:10).

questions.question: What drastic action did Athaliah take after Ahaziah's death?
options: She destroyed all the royal seed of the house of Judah
She crowned a new king immediately
She repented and sought the LORD
questions.correctAnswer: She destroyed all the royal seed of the house of Judah
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 22:10 records Athaliah destroyed all of Judah’s royal seed to secure power, illustrating the consequences of ungodly ambition and the threat to God’s covenant line (cf. Esther 3:13-15; Exodus 1:16-22; Matthew 2:16; Revelation 12:17).

questions.question: Who rescued Joash from Athaliah's massacre?
options: Jehoshabeath, the daughter of the king
questions.correctAnswer: Jehoshabeath, the daughter of the king
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 22:11 states Jehoshabeath, king Jehoram’s daughter, hid Joash and his nurse to preserve the Davidic line. This act of faith preserved God's promise of a Messiah (cf. Exodus 2:1-10; 1 Kings 11:19-20; Luke 1:32-33; Hebrews 7:14).

questions.question: Where was Joash hidden during Athaliah's reign?
options: In a private home outside Jerusalem
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 22:12 records Joash was hidden in the house of God for six years, symbolizing divine protection and the sanctity of God's covenant (cf. Psalm 27:4; 1 Kings 6:1; John 2:19-21; Hebrews 10:21-22).

questions.question: Which king reigned over Judah while Joash was hidden?
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 22:12 indicates Athaliah reigned during the six years Joash was hidden. Her reign represents a period of apostasy and usurpation that God would later overthrow (cf. 2 Kings 11; Revelation 17:5; Jeremiah 22:30; Galatians 1:4).

questions.question: What theological truth is underscored by the preservation of Joash despite Athaliah’s massacre?
options: God’s covenant faithfulness to David’s line
The success of rebellion against God
The temporary nature of God's promises
questions.correctAnswer: God’s covenant faithfulness to David’s line
questions.explanation: The preservation of Joash (2 Chronicles 22:11-12) highlights God's faithfulness to His covenant with David, ensuring the Messianic line continues despite human sinfulness (cf. 2 Samuel 7:12-16; Psalm 89:34-37; Acts 13:23; Romans 11:29).

questions.question: How does 2 Chronicles 22 portray the consequences of ungodly counsel in leadership?
options: Leaders who follow evil counsel face destruction and judgment
Leaders gain long and prosperous reigns
Evil counsel has no real impact on the kingdom
God blesses leaders regardless of their advisors
questions.correctAnswer: Leaders who follow evil counsel face destruction and judgment
questions.explanation: Ahaziah’s evil deeds influenced by Athaliah (2 Chronicles 22:3-4) led to his downfall, demonstrating that ungodly counsel brings judgment (cf. Proverbs 11:14; Jeremiah 23:16-22; Matthew 7:15-20; James 3:13-17).
